dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c sub (SW Masakadza) b Kamungozi 95 (120b 9x4 0x6 146m) SR: 79.16

dismissalComment.html: he won't get his hundred, and a pretty ordinary ball has got him out. It's short, angling towards leg stump, and he pulls it, uppishly, straight into the hands of deep midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Chigumbura b Panyangara 40 (33b 4x4 0x6 49m) SR: 121.21

dismissalComment.html: bangs it in short, and Shakib goes for the hook. Can't control it, and he top-edges high in the air down to long leg, where Chigumbura takes a good tumbling catch
bangs it in short, and Shakib goes for the hook. Can't control it, and he top-edges high in the air down to long leg, where Chigumbura takes a good tumbling catch
gone! What an over from Panyangara. Mushy went for the big drive through the off side with an angled bat, it was very full and it was angling in, and it took his inside edge onto the stumps

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalComment.html: he won't get his hundred, and a pretty ordinary ball has got him out. It's short, angling towards leg stump, and he pulls it, uppishly, straight into the hands of deep midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Taylor/Masakadza) 40 (63b 2x4 1x6 108m) SR: 63.49

dismissalComment.html: Oh my, that's unfortunate. They've gone to the third umpire, and it looks out. It's a slower ball on leg stump, and he works it away towards deep midwicket. They run a second and it would have been easily completed had Tamim not dropped his bat just short of reaching the bowler's end. He jammed it into the ground, looking to ground it, and it dropped out of his grasp. He had to jump into the crease, and his feet were in the air when Masakadza picked up Taylor's throw from the deep and disturbed the bails. For good measure, he threw to the other end as well, but obviously the ball became dead once Tamim was out at the bowler's end

headshotImage.caption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mominul Haque c Maruma b Masakadza 15 (24b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: got him! Mominul hasn't been middling them today and he went after this slower ball outside off, hit it too early, with an angled bat, and scooped a simple catch to mid-off

image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c sub (SW Masakadza) b Kamungozi 95 (120b 9x4 0x6 146m) SR: 79.16

dismissalComment.html: he won't get his hundred, and a pretty ordinary ball has got him out. It's short, angling towards leg stump, and he pulls it, uppishly, straight into the hands of deep midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Chigumbura b Panyangara 40 (33b 4x4 0x6 49m) SR: 121.21

dismissalComment.html: bangs it in short, and Shakib goes for the hook. Can't control it, and he top-edges high in the air down to long leg, where Chigumbura takes a good tumbling catch

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim b Panyangara 33 (22b 3x4 1x6 43m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: gone! What an over from Panyangara. Mushy went for the big drive through the off side with an angled bat, it was very full and it was angling in, and it took his inside edge onto the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Maruma b Madziva 22 (13b 3x4 0x6 25m) SR: 169.23

dismissalComment.html: short ball, it was the slower one, and he looks to pull and ends up hitting it uppishly into the hands of long-on. The fielder is right on the edge of the rope and he's moving back with the momentum of the catch but manages to stop himself just in time, from going over the rope

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura not out 53 (46b 4x4 2x6 81m) SR: 115.21
Brendan Taylor lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 28 (40b 5x4 0x6 62m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: gone! That was the arm ball again, and Taylor plonked his front pad right in front and played down the wrong line as he looked to defend. It looked plumb and the umpire had no hesitation

got him! The previous balls built up in the batsman's head and he rushed down the track and slogged wildly. It sneaked under his bat, went with the angle, and Mushfiqur was a little slow to complete the stumping, but the batsman was so far down the pitch that it didn't matter
got him. That was full on middle and leg, and he cleared his front leg and smashed it straight to short midwicket, who falls to his left to take a good catch
beauty. That was looped up outside off and he came forward, playing for the turn, and it went with the arm, through the gate, and crashed into his off stump

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. It's a little fuller, the arm ball again, sliding towards off stump. He clears his front leg and goes for the big slog sweep and plays all around the ball, which crashes into his stumps
got him. Comes down the track and goes for the pull. It gets a little too big on him, and he ended up scooping it high in the air, easy catch for the man running in from long leg

given! There was a loud shout for a catch down the leg side after Masakadza looked to glance one off his hips, and Masakadza is absolutely livid. He slaps the air with his bat a couple of times as he walks off, and one of the Zimbabwe substitutes came on and put an arm around his shoulder to lead him off the field. You could see why he was disappointed, he was nowhere near making contact with that.

dismissalText.long: c Arafat Sunny b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda c Arafat Sunny b Mashrafe Mortaza 9 (6b 2x4 0x6 10m) SR: 150

dismissalComment.html: got him. Comes down the track and goes for the pull. It gets a little too big on him, and he ended up scooping it high in the air, easy catch for the man running in from long leg

dismissalText.commentary: Timycen Maruma c Mashrafe Mortaza b Rubel Hossain 8 (16b 2x4 0x6 28m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: gone! It was shortish, goes for the pull, and doesn't get hold of it at all. Spoons it in the air, straight into the hands of Mashrafe at mid-on

dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva b Mahmudullah 14 (38b 0x4 0x6 29m) SR: 36.84

dismissalComment.html: that was always on the cards. Chakabva had been making room repeatedly and cutting balls off his stumps. This one went with the arm, went across him, and crashed into off stump. Kept a touch low too.

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor lbw b Rubel Hossain 2 (11b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 18.18

dismissalComment.html: big lbw appeal, given. He came half-forward to work it into the on side, and it was fasy and angling in. Beat the inside edge and hit him on the back pad, right in front

dismissalComment.html: got him. That was full on middle and leg, and he cleared his front leg and smashed it straight to short midwicket, who falls to his left to take a good catch

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Arafat Sunny 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: beauty. That was looped up outside off and he came forward, playing for the turn, and it went with the arm, through the gate, and crashed into his off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Tafadzwa Kamungozi b Arafat Sunny 4 (9b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. It's a little fuller, the arm ball again, sliding towards off stump. He clears his front leg and goes for the big slog sweep and plays all around the ball, which crashes into his stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Tafadzwa Kamungozi b Arafat Sunny 4 (9b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 44.44

commentTextItems.html: and that is that. It's a little fuller, the arm ball again, sliding towards off stump. He clears his front leg and goes for the big slog sweep and plays all around the ball, which crashes into his stumps

commentPostTextItems.html: 7.45pm And that's it from all of us. Another one-sided game, another Bangladesh win. Hopefully, the fourth ODI will be more of a contest. Do join us for that. Until then, ta ta!

7.40pm Presentation time. Elton Chigumbura: "I still think it's a good wicket to bat, and chasing was a good decision, but unfortunately we keep doing the same thing. We thought the guys who would come in would bring a different performance but still the same performance. Disappointing to lose three games in a row. I thought the guys were up for it, but we still made the same mistakes. Two most important games to go for us. We've got to make sure we finish well."

Mashrafe Mortaza: "I'm very happy, all the boys are very happy today. Once again Tamim and Bijoy were fabulous, and later on, even though they were small innings, Shakib, Mushfiq, Riyad and Sabbir played brilliantly. 2014 we have kept losing but now the momentum is coming, hopefully we'll keep it up."

Anamul Haque is the man of the match: "Little bit disappointed, two matches in a row I missed the centuries, but winning the match was the positive. Tamim Iqbal is one of the best openers in the world, and he helps me all the time. In the first 15 overs it was not easy to bat, so we tried to keep wickets. Mushy and Shakib also played very good."

Shreya Tanzin: "2 interesting things I noticed in this series: 1: A Sunny is becoming BD's tail-ender specialist, taking the last 2-3 wickets almost regularly 2: Bangladesh has around 8 full time bowlers, 4 of them are batting all-rounders within the team (including Shakib) , and 2 of them are pretty much masqueraded batsmen: Mominul & Sabbir. Good stuff! Although, it does mean, Nasir Hossain, one of my favs, will need to work hard for a place in this team."

ZCFOutkast: "One thing is certain, you can't blame the coach for such schoolboy batting mistakes because Simmons, Butcher, Streak, Grant, and Waller should've long eradicated them. Can only blame the batsmen."

7.32pm Zimbabwe are bowled out with 10.1 overs still left to play. Tells you all about their innings, and tells you how this tour has gone for them. It's Bangladesh's biggest win over Zimbabwe in terms of runs. For the second straight game, Sunny finishes with four wickets, including the last three.

commentPreTextItems.html: Santhosh Kumar: "@Aslam Hight of jinx mate you got Mathews out from other match :P"

commentTextItems.html: length ball, slides on towards off stump. He makes room and punches into the covers
down the track and that's a slightly mistimed hit down the ground, rolls down to long-on
now he makes room to cut, and makes a crisp connection but can't beat point
fired flat down the leg side, and he helps it away past short fine leg to bring up his half-century
quick arm ball heading towards off stump, he gets everything behind the line to defend

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentTextItems.html: a bit slower, drops onto a good length outside off, and he reaches out and blocks into the off side
full outside off and he drives sweetly through the gap between mid-off and cover
goes on the back foot again, this time he manages to tuck it away towards short fine leg
goes on the back foot to work it leg side, is hit on the pad by the arm ball, was definitely sliding down

commentPreTextItems.html: Hamid: "Arafat Sunny has become quite the Bounty paper towel: the quicker mopper-upper of tails!"
Everyone's in the circle now, saving the single

commentTextItems.html: full, angling into the pads, clipped to square leg
down the track, and he frees his arms and launches it straight back down the ground, lovely clean hit

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentTextItems.html: flat and quick, sliding down leg, tries to whip it through the on side and misses, is hit on the front pad
again it skids on with the angle, goes back and makes room to cut, can't beat backward point
flat, angling in towards leg stump, keeps a bit low. Goes back and chops down hurriedly into the off side
length ball outside off, makes some room and flat-bats it to long-off, refuses the single

commentPreTextItems.html: Arafat Sunny is on a hat-trick.

commentTextItems.html: shout for lbw for the full ball speared into the pads. Looked like it was sliding down leg

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

commentTextItems.html: down the track now, driven down the ground to long-off
keeps a little low, but he manages to defend it off the back foot, into the off side

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal run out (Taylor/Masakadza) 40 (63b 2x4 1x6 108m) SR: 63.49

dismissalComment.html: Oh my, that's unfortunate. They've gone to the third umpire, and it looks out. It's a slower ball on leg stump, and he works it away towards deep midwicket. They run a second and it would have been easily completed had Tamim not dropped his bat just short of reaching the bowler's end. He jammed it into the ground, looking to ground it, and it dropped out of his grasp. He had to jump into the crease, and his feet were in the air when Masakadza picked up Taylor's throw from the deep and disturbed the bails. For good measure, he threw to the other end as well, but obviously the ball became dead once Tamim was out at the bowler's end

dismissalComment.html: big lbw appeal, given. He came half-forward to work it into the on side, and it was fasy and angling in. Beat the inside edge and hit him on the back pad, right in front

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c sub (Imrul Kayes) b Arafat Sunny
dismissalText.commentary: Neville Madziva c sub (Imrul Kayes) b Arafat Sunny 11 (24b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 45.83

dismissalComment.html: got him. That was full on middle and leg, and he cleared his front leg and smashed it straight to short midwicket, who falls to his left to take a good catch

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Arafat Sunny 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: beauty. That was looped up outside off and he came forward, playing for the turn, and it went with the arm, through the gate, and crashed into his off stump

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Tafadzwa Kamungozi b Arafat Sunny 4 (9b 1x4 0x6 11m) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. It's a little fuller, the arm ball again, sliding towards off stump. He clears his front leg and goes for the big slog sweep and plays all around the ball, which crashes into his stumps
got him. Comes down the track and goes for the pull. It gets a little too big on him, and he ended up scooping it high in the air, easy catch for the man running in from long leg

given! There was a loud shout for a catch down the leg side after Masakadza looked to glance one off his hips, and Masakadza is absolutely livid. He slaps the air with his bat a couple of times as he walks off, and one of the Zimbabwe substitutes came on and put an arm around his shoulder to lead him off the field. You could see why he was disappointed, he was nowhere near making contact with that.

headshotImage.caption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shafiul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! It was shortish, goes for the pull, and doesn't get hold of it at all. Spoons it in the air, straight into the hands of Mashrafe at mid-on
big lbw appeal, given. He came half-forward to work it into the on side, and it was fasy and angling in. Beat the inside edge and hit him on the back pad, right in front

got him! The previous balls built up in the batsman's head and he rushed down the track and slogged wildly. It sneaked under his bat, went with the angle, and Mushfiqur was a little slow to complete the stumping, but the batsman was so far down the pitch that it didn't matter
got him. That was full on middle and leg, and he cleared his front leg and smashed it straight to short midwicket, who falls to his left to take a good catch
beauty. That was looped up outside off and he came forward, playing for the turn, and it went with the arm, through the gate, and crashed into his off stump

dismissalComment.html: and that is that. It's a little fuller, the arm ball again, sliding towards off stump. He clears his front leg and goes for the big slog sweep and plays all around the ball, which crashes into his stumps
gone! That was the arm ball again, and Taylor plonked his front pad right in front and played down the wrong line as he looked to defend. It looked plumb and the umpire had no hesitation

dismissalComment.html: that was always on the cards. Chakabva had been making room repeatedly and cutting balls off his stumps. This one went with the arm, went across him, and crashed into off stump. Kept a touch low too.

stories.title: Anamul thirsts for the long innings
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Anamul Haque thirsts for the long innings
stories.summary: Anamul Haque admitted regret over missing out on a fourth ODI ton, but said he wanted to play longer innings after getting set

stories.title: Chigumbura rues repetition of mistakes
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Elton Chigumbura was disappointed by his team committing the same mistakes every match to lose the ODI series 3-0, with two matches still left

stories.title: Anamul and Sunny star in series win
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Anamul and Sunny star in series win
stories.summary: Important runs and early wickets were the reason for Bangladesh's 124-run win over Zimbabwe in the third ODI in Mirpur, which also gave them the series with two matches in hand

image.caption: Anamul Haque celebrates his fifty
image.longCaption: Anamul Haque celebrates his fifty, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, November 26, 2014

stories.title: 'Series win is a necessity' - Mashrafe
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'Series win is a necessity' - Mashrafe Mortaza
stories.summary: Mashrafe Mortaza wants Bangladesh to wrap up a series win in the third ODI itself, saying that it will provide a huge lift before the World Cup

image.caption: Performance psychologist Dr Phil Jauncey talks to the Bangladesh team
image.longCaption: Performance psychologist Dr Phil Jauncey talks to the Bangladesh team, Mirpur, November 25, 2014

stories.title: Bangladesh out to wrap up series
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh out to wrap up series
stories.summary: Bangladesh will be looking to close out the series as they enter the third ODI with a 2-0 lead

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza is congratulated by team-mates after a wicket
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza is congratulated by team-mates after a wicket , Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 2nd ODI, Chittagong, November 23, 2014

videos.title: Anamul and Sunny down Zimbabwe
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
videos.summary: Bangladesh beat Zimbabwe by 124 runs in Dhaka with the help of Anamul Haque's 95 and Arafat Sunny's four-wicket haul to clinch the five game ODI series 3-0 with two matches to play

videos.title: Anamul and Sunny down Zimbabwe
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
videos.summary: ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent Mohammad Isam reports on Bangladesh's comprehensive victory over Zimbabwe by 124 runs in Dhaka to clinch the five game ODI series 3-0 with two matches to play

videos.title: Zimbabwe look to save series
videos.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur
videos.summary: Bangladesh and Zimbabwe meet in Mirpur for the third ODI as Zimbabwe looks desperately for a win to stem a bleak run of form
